content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
No new structures have been successfully established on the map. The agent repeatedly attempted to craft and place a Lab intended for supplying Automation Science Packs at position (0.5, 2.5), but these efforts failed due to missing inventory items and insufficient sub-ingredients. Although pre‐existing smelting facilities (a furnace at Position(x=5.0, y=5.0) used for iron smelting and a copper furnace at Position(x=-27.0, y=-60.0) used for copper plate production) were referenced during production processes, no new production or research structures were constructed.

ERROR TIPS
────────────
• API Usage Consistency
  - Call functions with the correct signature. The get_entities() function was first invoked with an unsupported keyword argument ('radius') and later with an incorrect number of positional arguments. Verify parameter requirements before usage.

• Handling Undefined or None Returns
  - When retrieving entities (for example, attempting to list Labs), ensure the result is not None before iterating. Fallback to an empty collection to prevent errors from iterating over None.

• Lab Crafting and Placement Failures
  - Ensure that all required sub-ingredients (such as iron-gear-wheel, electronic-circuit, and copper-cable) are available prior to initiating Lab crafting. 
  - Confirm that the Lab is present in the inventory before attempting to place it, to avoid placement errors indicating “No lab in inventory.”

• Resource and Dependency Management
  - Monitor and secure sufficient raw materials and processed components (like iron plates and copper plates) so that intermediate products can be crafted reliably. 
  - Verify that the necessary smelting and crafting processes are in place to support the production of complex items such as the Lab.
